result.execSummary:
The defendant Nathan A Wrobel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Nathan A Wrobel is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Nathan A Wrobel was found guilty of Theft-Movable Property >$10,000 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Nathan A Wrobel was found guilty of Theft-Movable Property >$10,000 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Nathan A Wrobel was found guilty of Theft-Movable Property >$10,000 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime
PTAC, as a Party to a Crime
PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  Cash bond posted shall be applied.   
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered. 
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.   
*  Pay restitution in the sum of $300,000.00 plus surcharges Joint & severally with B. Ambrosini.    
*  Perform  200 hours of community service for a public agency or a nonprofit charitable organization.   
May not have contact with Snap-On Property or Brian Ambrosini, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  Cash bond posted shall be applied.    
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  
*  Pay restitution Joint & Severally with Brian Ambrosini.  Amount shown in extened supervision.  
*  Perform community service.  Amount of hours shown in extended supervision.    
May not have contact with Brian AMbrosini or Snap-On Tools, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.   
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

09:13 AM  State appears by Attorney Alexander Huber. Defendant Nathan A Wrobel not in court. Probation Agent Sam Damijan appeared by phone means.  Clerk: HN.  PA reports DE has made some payments over the years. Victim witness fees are still owed.  State does not object to a civil judgment for remaining fees on this case. Discussion held on restitution.  Court finds DE has not made a good faith effort to pay restitution and victim witness fees. Court amends JOC to include the $300,000 of restitution owed on charges 5 & 6 and extends probation for 2 years on counts 5 & 6.  PA to prepare extension paperwork.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State. DE in person, with Atty. D. Hertz-McGrath. Clerk RMM
State in victim/witness compliance. Sentencing arguments made. 
Count 4: 6 years WSP; 1 year initial confinement 5 years extended supervision. 
Count 5 and 6: sentence withheld 6 years probation.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State. Defendant, Nathan A Wrobel, appeared with Attorney Denise Hertz-Mcgrath.  Clerk: PT
State is compliant with victim rights notification and a representative is present in court.  Case is resolved.  Counts 1, 2 and 3 - Dismissed by the State.  Counts 4, 5 and 6 - DE pleads Guilty; found guilty by the court.  Restitution is contested jointly with co-defendant so both Atty Hertz-McGrath and Atty Zievers request a joint restitution hearing.  Joint restitution hearing to be scheduled before Comm. Dowse.  PSI ordered and sentencing is set out to August following the restitution hearing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 8, 2016 at 01:45 pm.

Defendant, Nathan A Wrobel, appeared with Attorney Denise s Hertz-Mcgrath.  Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the Prosecution. Clerk: N. Jurgens. 
MINUTES: DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found. Substitution filed on Br 3, tab pulled for Br 8. Bound over to Br 8. Information filed, reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary Hearing Waiver/Plea Offer
to Preliminary Hearing
of Judge Schroeder filed by Atty Hertz-McGrath, tab pulled for Br 8 Judge Kerkman

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State. Def. appeared in court without counsel. Clerk LE. Case was scheduled for preliminary hearing today, but Atty. Hertz-McGrath is out sick. Time limits tolled due to unavailability of def. counsel. Preliminary hearing rescheduled to 7-8-15 @ 10:00am. Bond continued.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State. Def. appeared in court with Atty. Denise Hertz-McGrath. Clerk LE. Case was scheduled for preliminary hearing this morning. Joint request for adjournment of preliminary hearing. Court grants adjournment. Time limits tolled. Preliminary hearing rescheduled to 6-23-15 @ 8:30am. Bond continued.
